oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter sent by Gen. John J. Pershing to the troops.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A copy of Gen. Hdqtrs. AEF, General Order No. 38-A furnished to Sgt. Wilson A. Dowdy. Gen. Pershing wrote the citizen-soldiers of the AEF as their service was about to end. "Our democracy has been tested, and the forces of autocracy have been defeated." He told them that their part had been an important one in the victory. "With consecrated devotion to duty and a will to conquer, you have loyally served your country." With pride, he offered his sincere thanks for their splendid service to the nation.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:instructionalMethod: US.28; John J. Pershing; World War I
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
